PATIENT_ID: TEST_PERIPH_VASC_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-03 12:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-03 12:10:00
Category I activation for 38-year-old male with lower extremity injury.
GSW to right thigh with massive hemorrhage. Extremity trauma confirmed.
BP 78/48, HR 140, RR 28, GCS 15.
Right lower extremity with pulsatile hemorrhage from wound.
Absent distal pulses in right foot. Limb ischemia evident
with pallor and absent dorsalis pedis pulse.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-03 12:15:00
Tourniquet applied to right proximal thigh. Hemorrhage controlled.
Vascular examination: absent distal pulses right lower extremity.
Pulse examination confirms no palpable pulse distally.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-03 12:30:00
CT angiography right lower extremity obtained.
CTA demonstrates transection of superficial femoral artery.
Active contrast extravasation identified.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-03 12:40:00
Hard signs of arterial injury confirmed: absent distal pulses,
pulsatile hemorrhage, and limb ischemia.
Vascular surgery consulted for emergent repair.
Pulses absent distally confirmed on Doppler assessment. ABI 0.2 right.
